headline: TO TEST BIRTH CONTROL; Puerto Rico Asks Opinion of U. S. on Legality of Clinics
snippet: The United States Attorney General has been asked to decide whether the island's recent laws providing for government birth-control clinics conflict with Federal statutes. Meantime fourteen clinics privately sponsored and staffed have been operating...

headline: Y.W.C.A.Rallies List Birth Control And Japanese Boycott as Topics; Three Meetings in Metropolitan Area Will Take Up Subjects of Public Interest, Including Hour-and-Wages Law, Anti. Lynching, Child Labor, Social Security and Civil Rights
snippet: A reviving interest in public affairs, shown last week in committee meetings at the Y. W. C. A., has resulted in plans for three rallies in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, at which State leaders and delegates will discuss methods of forming...

headline: Quezon Opposes Birth Control
snippet: Opposes birth control for P I

headline: SPLIT ON BIRTH CONTROL; Chicago Catholic Women Threaten to Quit Parents-Teachers Congress
snippet: Members of the Council of Catholic Women of the Archdiocese of Chicago voted today to resign from the Illinois Congress of Parents and Teachers unless it withdraws its recent adoption of a birth control program.

headline: Fined in Birth Control Case
snippet: Mrs L D Hawkridge and C C Davis fined for violating Mass laws in giving information

headline: BACK BIRTH CONTROL DATA; Illinois Parent-Teacher Leaders Plan Education Drive
snippet: A plan to disseminate birth control information among the 130,000 members of the congress was adopted today by the executive committee of the Illinois Congress of Parents and Teachers.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL AIDE SEES FOES FAILING; Dr. Matsner, Back From Europe, Cites Statistics of Germant, France and Italy
snippet: Dr. Eric M. Matsner, medical director of the American Birth Control League and executive secretary of the National Medical Council on Birth Control, declared on his return from Europe on the French liner Lafayette yesterday that Americans and British...

headline: WIN BIRTH CONTROL POINT; Bay State Advocates Now Seek to Raise Defense Fund
snippet: Heartened by its first technical court victory in Massachusetts, the Birth Control League today sought funds to carry its battle to the United States Supreme Court if necessary.

headline: BOSTON HEADS CLOSE BIRTH CONTROL UNITS; Massachusetts League Acts Pending a Court Ruling on Legality of Work
snippet: Branch offices of the Birth Control League of Massachusetts, beset by police raids, prepared tonight to discontinue operations on recommendations of its executive board.

headline: DR. MATSNER DEPARTS; Birth Control Leader to Attend International Conference
snippet: Dr. Eric M. Matsner, medical director of the American Birth Control League and executive secretary of the National Medical Council on Birth Control, sailed yesterday on the Holland-America liner Statendam to confer with European birth control...

headline: Fined in Birth Control Case
snippet: Fined for giving birth control information, Salem, Mass

headline: MORE CLINICS URGED FOR BIRTH CONTROL; Increase to 3,000 to Aid All Mothers in United States Is Mrs. Sanger's Aim
snippet: A ten-fold increase in existing birth-control clinics to 3,000 is recommended by Mrs. Margaret Sanger, birth-control leader, in a report on the seven years' work of the National Committee on Federal Legislation for Birth Control, which will be issued...

headline: FISHBEIN PREDICTS NEW BIRTH CONTROL; Injection of Some Substance Will Make Women Sterile for Two Years, He Believes
snippet: The time will come when, by the injection of some substance into the blood stream, women may be made sterile for two or three years, Dr. Morris Fishbein, editor of The Journal of the American Medical Association, said yesterday.

headline: PHYSICIANS SPLIT ON BIRTH CONTROL; Members of 2 Groups Praise Action of A. M. A. in Voting Recognition of Problem
snippet: The American Birth Control League and the National Medical Council on Birth Control struck back today at the Rev. Ignatius Cox, Professov of Ethics at Fordham University, who yesterday took issue with the American Medical Association for its...

headline: CATHOLICS TO FIGHT BIRTH CONTROL AID; Father Cox to Urge Doctors of Faith to Back Opposition to Contraceptives' Use
snippet: A legion of decency to combat "firms dealing in contraceptives and doctors approving of their use" will be advocated by the Rev. Ignatius Cox, Professor of Ethics at Fordham University, as a partial answer to recognition of birth-control measures by...

headline: Birth Control Is Accepted By American Medical Body; Association Backs Doctors in Use of 'Legal Rights' on Contraceptive Advice--Hearing Today on Public Health Issue
snippet: After a struggle of many years birth control received its first official recognition here today from the American Medical Association, which represents organized medicine in the United States.

headline: 1,000 NURSES ATTEND MASS IN ST. PATRICK'S; Dr. J. A. O'Regan Appeals to Them to Aid Fight on Social Diseases-Birth Control Attacked
snippet: The fight on social diseases was endorsed and birth control was attacked by speakers yesterday at the annual communion breakfast of the Catholic Club -for Nurses of the Archdiocese at the Hotel Commodore. About 1,000 uniformed student and graduate...

headline: BIRTH CONTROL LAW SIGNED AT SAN JUAN; Acting Governor Puts Name to Bill After Its Passage by Insular Legislature; CHURCH OPPOSED MEASURE; Rapid Population Increase Held Important Factor in Island's Problem of Relief
snippet: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, May 1.-Dissemination of information look ing toward birth control today be came legal with the signing of a bill passed by the Insular Legisla ture striking out birth control pro hibition. The signature of Rafael Menendez...

headline: 1,500 HOAXED AT HARVARD; Orders to Go to Lecture on Birth Control Cause Hunt for Culprit
snippet: Out of 3,500 potential victims, 1,500 to 2,000 Harvard students were hoaxed today by the distribution of cards, apparently from the Department of Hygiene, directing them to attend a lecture on "Scientific Aspects of Birth Control."

headline: Birth Control Bill Passes Both Puerto Rican Houses
snippet: Physicians may give birthcontrol information to patients, under the terms of a bill passed in both houses and now before Governor Blanton Winship for his signature.

headline: DROP IN POPULATION FEARED FOR NATION; Birth-Control Move May Push Census to 75,000,000, Life Insurance Man Says
snippet: An impetus unremarked by all but a few is carrying this country rapidly toward a reckoning on its population problems, Dr. Louis I. Dublin predicted yesterday. Vast social changes already impressed on the lives of average American women by the trend...

headline: BIRTH CONTROL AIDE FREED; Ontario Magistrate Finds Social Worker Served Public Welfare
snippet: Magistrate Lester Clayton ruled today that dissemination of information on contraceptives was in "the public good."

headline: Birth Control Approved By Bishop of Birmingham
snippet: Both voluntary euthanasia and birth control were approved today by Dr. E. W. Barnes, Bishop of Birmingham, in a sermon at Oxford University.

headline: BIRTH CONTROL FOR EGYPT; Grand Mufti Approves Moslem's Increasing Practice
snippet: Replying to inquiries from many Moslems, Sheikh Abd el-Magid Salim, Grand Mufti of Egypt, issued today a statement generally approving birth control by married Moslems.

headline: PATH HELD CLEARED FOR BIRTH CONTROL; Ernst Says Court Decision Has Removed Last Barrier to Program of League
snippet: The recent Federal court decision upholding the right of physicians to give contraceptive advice for the well-being of patients has removed the last restriction on birth control, according to speakers yesterday at the sixteenth annual luncheon of the...

headline: REV. A. Z. CONRAD IS DEAD IN BOSTON; Served as Pastor of the Park St. Congregational Church for More Than 30 Years LONG KNOWN AS CRUSADER Led Drives on Liquor, Birth Control, Divorce--Conducted Forum and Question Period
snippet: The Rev. A. Z. Conrad, for more than three decades pastor of Park Street Congregational Church, died at Phillips House, Massachusetts General Hospital, last night at the age of 81 after an illness of more than a year.

headline: URGES BIRTH CONTROL TO KEEP WORLD PEACE; Mrs. Sanger Sees Menace in Rising Populations of Italy, Germany and Japan.
snippet: Asserting that rapidly increasing populations of Germany, Italy and Japan are a menace to peace because of the "inevitable need" for territrial expansion,

headline: MRS. SANGER GETS TOWN HALL MEDAL; Birth Control Leader Praises U. S. Court for Ruling Liberalizing Law.
snippet: Margaret Sanger, in response to the presentation to her of the Town Hall Club Medal for hr pioneer work in behalf of birth control, said last night that "the. shaking apart of the laws which at last separate scientific birth control from obscenity...
